results.title: The Scent of green papaya = l'odeur de la papaye verte
results.creator_credit: Christophe Rossignon, Productions Lazennec, SFP Cinema, La Sept Cinema and Tran Anh Hung
results.brief_description: Vietnam, 1950. Mui, a young country girl, joins a Saigon family as their servant and develops an enduring but secret attachment to Khuyen (Vuong Hoa Hoi), a friend of the eldest son. Some years later, when the family fortune declines and they can no longer afford to keep her, Mui (Nu Yen-Khe Tran), now 20, is sent to serve in the household of her childhood love who has now become a successful musician. Shot entirely in a French studio, Hung’s film is more concerned with the minute details of everyday Vietnamese life and the tones, colors, and feelings of a lost society. Hung casted non-professional actors, mostly Vietnamese living in Paris, who had to re-learn certain ritual gestures and Vietnamese language. His approach to this gentle world is reminiscent of Satyajit Ray and Ozu. He nudges the film forward by subtle, quiet strokes. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (1993): best First Feature Film for Tran Anh Hung ; Cannes Film Festival: Camera d’Or for Best First Film. Cast includes Nu Yen-Khe Tran, Truong Thi Loc and Nguyen Anh Hoa. In Vietnamese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Scene from Melbury House
results.brief_description: As a training exercise for their apprentice cameramen, British Transport Films used scrap lengths of film to record the varied daily lives of their neighbours as seen from the roof of their building in London’s Marylebone. A film without commentary featuring the music of Vaughan Williams. Nominated for a BAFTA award in 1974.

results.title: The Scarlet pimpernel [Grant]
results.creator_credit: Julian Murphy, BBC-TV, London Film Productions, A&E Television Networks, Edward Bennett and Patrick Lau
results.brief_description: France, 1793 and the terror of the French Revolution is at it’s height. Every day the tumbrils roll more innocent people to their deaths under the guillotine, but there is one man who dares to defy the revolutionaries; The Scarlet Pimpernel. Richard E. Grant plays the foppish English aristocrat Sir Percy Blakeney, a cad with a passion only for society and clothes but who leads a daring and exciting double life - as the Scarlet Pimpernel. This vibrant three part series is full of murder, double dealing, intrigue and passion that will keep you in suspense until the very end. Cast includes the beautiful Elizabeth McGovern as Lady Blakeney and Martin Shaw as the evil, self-centered, Chauvelin, right hand man of Robspierre.

results.title: The Scarlet Pimpernel
results.brief_description: In the early days of the French Revolution, a mysterious flower-brandishing Englishman, known affectionately and notoriously as the Scarlet Pimpernel, is leading a daring band in the timely rescue of aristocrats from the guillotine. Unbeknown to his beautiful French wife the Scarlet Pimpernel is, in reality, none other than Sir Percy Blakeney who feigns poetry-reading foppishness as his disguise. Based on the popular romantic novel by Baroness Orczy, a richly detailed historical background and splendid plot make “The Scarlet Pimpernel” a first-class period adventure. Stars Leslie Howard and Merle Oberon. Rated: G

results.title: The Scarlet pimpernel
results.creator_credit: David Conroy, London Film Productions and Clive Donner
results.brief_description: Sir Percy Blakeney, Baronet, alias “The Scarlett Pimpernel” was the literary creation of Baronet Orczy. Sir Percy’s escapades during the French Revolution, where he and his band of young English noblemen risk life and limb to rescue the ‘aristos’ from the clutches of the guillotine, are vividly brought to life in this film made for television. Anthony Andrews is the dashing and elegant Sir Percy, Jane Seymour plays his lovely French wife Marguerite and Ian McKellen is Chauvelin, Sir Percy’s arch enemy. The costumes are sumptuous and the dialogue witty.

results.title: The Scarlet letter
results.creator_credit: Lightmotive, Allied Artists Pictures, Cinergi, Moving Pictures and Roland Joffe
results.brief_description: Demi Moore stars as Hester Prynne, a sensual, spirited young woman who arrives in a small Puritan town in New England to prepare a home for the upcoming arrival of her husband. There she meets the sensitive and appealing town minister, Rev. Dimmesdale (Gary Oldman), with whom she shares an undeniable attraction. When events soon reveal that Hester’s husband has been attacked by Indians and is presumed dead, neither Hester nor Dimmesdale can suppress their feelings anymore and a forbidden affair ignites. Upon discovering Hester is pregnant, the intolerant townspeople brand her an adulteress and, when she refuses to reveal the identity of her lover, they force her to wear a scarlet letter “A” on her dress as a brand of shame. Loosely based on the novel by Nathaniel Hawthorne.

results.title: The Scarecrow
results.creator_credit: Rob Whitehouse, Oasis Films, New Zealand National Film Unit and Sam Pillsbury
results.brief_description: Set in post war small town New Zealand, “The Scarecrow” is a suspenseful tale told through the eyes of adolescent Ned (Jonathan Smith). He and his friend Les (Daniel McLaren) become involved in the diabolical actions of the Scarecrow (John Carradine). With several mysterious deaths and near misses, the story reaches a climax, only to leave the audience with an unexpected finale. Based on a novel by Ronald Hugh Morrieson, “The Scarecrow” is the feature debut of director Sam Pillsbury. The film is full of telling and often comic details of life in the small community. Gothic elements are highlighted by the presence of the Scarecrow and insistence upon the eccentric. Cast also includes Tracy Mann.

results.title: The Scarab mechanical horse
results.creator_credit: Gordon O'Connell and Gate Film Production
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the special advances in modern industry and communication of the Scarab Mechanical Horse, a three-wheeled traction united designed to tow a variety of trailers. Shows the ingenious automatic coupling mechanism which joins traction unit and trailer, and how swift interchangeability can be completed by only one man. Gives examples of it use in road services, railway yards, municipal cleansing and other functions.

results.title: The Scale of the cosmos
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastline Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Questions about our universe have intrigued the human race since time began. What is the universe made of? How did it come to be? How big is it? Even though astronomers concern themselves with these questions on a scientific level, what remains is a sense of wonder. Even using relative comparisons, the vastness of the universe is still a mystery. Stars, supernova, pulsars and black holes are just some of the phenomenon used to determine the scale of the universe.

results.title: The Saviour
results.creator_credit: Stuart Parkyn, Peter Templeman and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Malcolm is a gentle, effective door-to-door evangelist who is in love with a married woman. With pressure mounting from his church to convert her, Malcolm decides his bible is the very weapon he needs to destroy the marriage that is keeping him from his true love. Grand Jury Prize for Best Narrative Short, Slamdance Film Festvial, Park City, USA, 2006
Cast includes Thomas Campbell, Susan Prior, David Somerville, Rhys Muldoon, Nicholas Hammond.
